content: in this legal case in estonia the harju county court made a final decision after a 3year and 11month process the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs although the specific amount was not mentioned the court partially dismissed one partys claim and partially satisfied the other partys counterclaim the court divided the joint assets between the parties leaving certain shares and awarding compensation to each party the court rejected certain claims for the distribution of compensation and expenses incurred by the joint assets the court also stated that the procedural costs would be borne by the parties the court canceled a previous order and prohibited the disposal of certain property both parties have the option to appeal the courts decision within 30 days the court based its decision on the family law act and the property act the court considered whether certain assets should be recognized as joint or separate and whether certain expenses should be included in the joint assets the court also examined transfers made by one party to the other during the marriage to determine if they should be considered contributions to the joint assets the court found evidence to support some claims but dismissed others the court determined the value of certain assets based on the evidence provided the court also addressed the division of joint assets and ordered compensation to be paid to one party procedural costs were assigned to one party but the court partially exempted them from paying certain costs state legal aid was assigned to one party and the court ruled on the payment of procedural costs the summary does not provide specific details about the parties involved or the code articles referenced in the original text

metadata.cost: Each party covers own procedural costs, unspecified amounts
